Dear all,

I have been running heritrix (1.4.0) for about 10 days, with about 10,000 
seeds, broad scope, Tom Emerson's "HTML only" filters, 150 threads, and 
pretty much all other settings with default values.

I have two problems.

Problem one is that this morning I received the following e-mail. I 
remember that there was a thread about a similar problem a few months ago, 
but I am not able to locate it in the archives -- could somebody kindly 
point me to the relevant thread, or give me fresh advice if previous advice 
is not relevant?

Your web page says to let you know if your web crawler doesn't behave
well. I thought you would be interested to know that your web crawler
generated 88 error404 messages in one day on one single page (
http://water.usgs.gov/ogw/bgas/forms/course_evaluation.html). To the best
of my knowledge, the page is fully functional, and the problem is in your
how your web bot handled the form.

Second, this morning I also noticed an out-of-memory error, and the crawler 
was in pause mode. I sort of expected this, given the warnings re broad 
scope in the documentation, but I am wondering: is there any use in 
resuming the job (I crawled about half as much the data I would like to 
crawl), or will it get out of memory again soon anyway? Any other solution? 
(e.g., some setting I can change on the fly?)

Thanks in advance.

Best regards,

Marco
